III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation #1:
On 07/22/2025, youth sustained a bruise on her left wrist the size
of a quarter after Staff 3 grabbed her. Further, staff will pinch or
grab youth and the other girls in the stomach or hips.
Allegation #2:
Today, Supervisor pushed youth off her bed onto the floor in
addition to pushing her head into the wall when grabbing a cup
from her.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 7/24/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Staff 1 denied observing Youth A
being grabbed or seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A. Staff 1
denied seeing Staff 3 pinching Youth A or any other youth. Staff 1
denied being aware of any complaints from any youth regarding
any staff including Staff 3 and Supervisor regarding any pinching,
grabbing, or hitting of Youth A or any other youth.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
along with DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Program Manager
denied knowledge or observing any marks or bruises on Youth A
at anytime, awareness or witnessing any staff including Staff 3
pinching, grabbing, or hitting Youth A or any other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Youth B reported Staff 3 will pinch
multiple youth but mainly does it to Youth D. Youth B denied being
aware if it leaves marks on anyone. Youth B could not recall
where on the body Staff 3 pinches youth. Youth B denied
2

observing a bruise or mark on Youth A. Youth B denied being
grabbed or observing staff grab any youth at the facility. Youth B
denied having been pinched herself by Staff 3.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Youth C reported she has heard
that Staff 3 pinches youth and was not sure who she heard this
from or which youth get pinched or where they get pinched at the
time. Youth C was not aware of any marks from Staff 3 pinching
anyone. Youth C was not aware of any bruises on Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Youth D reported Staff 3 pinches
her and squeezes youth’s arms tightly. Youth D reported Staff 3’s
nails will leave marks on her arm from pinching. Youth D denied
having any current marks from Staff 3 pinching or scratching her.
Youth D reported Staff 6 has seen Staff 3 pinch her before. Youth
D could not remember which other youth Staff 3 will pinch or
scratch. Youth D was not aware of any bruises on Youth A.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 8 denied seeing or hearing
that Youth A had any bruises or marks. Staff 8 denied awareness
or witnessing Staff 3 pinching or scratching any of the youth in the
home.
Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 7 denied awareness of Staff
3 or any other staff grabbing, pinching or scratching Youth A or
any of the youth. Staff 7 reported youth will complain about Staff 3
because Staff 3 holds them accountable. Staff 7 denied observing
Staff 3 ever doing anything inappropriate towards the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Supervisor denied witnessing or
awareness of Staff 3 grabbing, pinching, or scratching any of the
youth in the home or being aware of any complaints of Staff 3
making any youth in the home uncomfortable. Supervisor denied
seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A following the incident.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 5 denied observing or
hearing about Staff 3 grabbing, pinching or scratching any of the
youth in the facility including Youth A. Staff 5 denied observing
any marks or bruises on Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 3 denied grabbing, pinching,
3

or scratching Youth A. Staff 3 reported she is playful with Youth D
sometimes who will try to pull her wig. Staff 3 denied ever
accidentally scratching any youth with her nails. Staff 3 denied
observing a bruise or mark on Youth A. Staff 3 denied ever
leaving a bruise or mark on any youth including Youth A. Staff 3
denied grabbing Youth A by the wrist at any time.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone along with DHHS Specialist
on 8/7/2025. Staff 6 reported hearing youth say Staff 3 will pinch
them to wake them up and some of the youth say it hurts. Staff 6
reported Youth A has stated Staff 3 pinches her. Staff 6 denied
witnessing Staff 3 pinch Youth A or any of the other youth or
seeing marks from the pinching. Staff 6 reported she has heard
youth complain about it hurting them and heard Staff 3 respond
saying “you know that don’t hurt.” Staff 6 could not recall which
youth complain about the pinching hurting. Staff 6 did not recall
observing a bruise or mark on Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the hospital on
8/14/2025. Youth A reported Staff 3 would pinch her on her
stomach and thighs. Youth A reported Staff 3 made her feel
uncomfortable with all her touching and pinching. Youth A
reported she has gotten red marks from the pinching. Youth A
reported Staff 3 left a bruise on her wrist recently when she
grabbed her by the wrist to stop her from walking. Youth A
reported this occurred when Staff 3 wanted to stop her to
apologize to her for thinking Youth A said something inappropriate
about Staff 3 but found out it was not true. Youth A could not recall
when this occurred or if anyone else was present.
Documentation Review:
• Training Record for Staff 3 documents 27.5 hours of
training including supportive adult training.
• Disciplinary Action for Staff 3 dated 8/22/23 regarding
leaving youth unsupervised.
• The Role of Staff Member states staff should never be
inappropriate with youth in any manner.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 7/24/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Staff 1 denied being aware of any
4

complaints from any youth regarding any staff including Staff 3
and Supervisor regarding any pinching or hitting of youth. Staff 1
denied observing or hearing about Youth A being pushed off of a
bed by Supervisor or by any other staff. Staff 1 denied observing
Youth A hit her head while in the bedroom and denied Youth A
falling to the floor.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
along with DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Program Manager did
not have any further information regarding this allegation.
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, Staff 3, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7
were interviewed face to face separately at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025 and on 7/30/2025. None of these
individuals observed what occurred inside Youth A’s bedroom and
did no have further information regarding this allegation.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 8 reported Youth A went into
her room as did Supervisor and Staff 1. Staff 8 reported she did
not see what occurred in the room as she was cleaning the mess
in the hallway. Staff 8 reported she heard Youth A say something
like “oh did you need that?” then Supervisor instructed Staff 8 to
call the police and stated that Youth A threw something at her.
Staff 8 denied seeing or hearing that Youth A hit her head on
anything.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Supervisor denied Youth A hitting
her head on anything or falling off of the bed at any point.
Supervisor denied pushing Youth A or observing anyone else
push Youth A. Supervisor denied anything being said while Youth
A was on the bed. Supervisor reported going to put the sheet into
the trash bag when something struck her in the face from Youth A
throwing it at her. Supervisor reported Staff 8 had entered the
doorway at which time she told Staff 8 to call the police.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the hospital on
8/14/2025. Youth A reported she got up and went into her room
where Staff 1 was picking up her things. Youth A reported
Supervisor entered the bedroom to assist Staff 1. Youth A
reported she sat on her bed when Supervisor and Staff 1 were
picking up the sheets. Youth A denied she was told to get up.
Youth A reported Supervisor and Staff 1 pulled on the sheets
causing her to fall off the bed onto the floor. Youth A reported
having a bruise on her hip from falling. Youth A reported having
nail polish and a cup of water that she grabbed and dumped the
5

nail polish into the cup. Youth A reported sitting down in her room
and starting to drink it. Youth A reported Supervisor pushed her
head against the wall while she was drinking the liquid. Youth A
denied throwing any object at Supervisor or at anyone else. Youth
A reported Supervisor told Staff 8 to call the police. Youth A
denied Supervisor was hit by anything during the incident.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report (IR) dated 7/23/25 authored by Supervisor
is consistent with Supervisor interview. IR further states
when police arrived Youth A denied throwing anything at
Supervisor and stated she was suicidal, that she had
ingested nail polish and cleaner. IR states police contacted
EMS who Youth A also told she was suicidal. IR states
Youth A was transported to the hospital for crisis screening
at the recommendation of police and EMS. IR states upon
arrival to the hospital Youth A said she did not want to end
her life and that her actions were only meant to self-harm.
• Training Record for Supervisor documents 27.5 hours of
training including verbal de-escalation and mandatory
reporting.
• Nurse Practitioner note dated 7/24/2025 states Youth A
had no significant injuries.
Video Review:
• Video footage does not include view of inside the bedroom.
Analysis Allegation 1:
A violation is not established regarding this allegation. There is
insufficient evidence of Staff 3 causing physical harm to Youth A
or any other youth by pinching or scratching.
Consultation:
Due to interviews providing inconsistent support of Staff 3
pinching or touching youth, it is recommended the facility clarify
appropriate touch by adding to policy staff are not to pinch or
scratch youth.
Allegation #2
No rule violation is established regarding allegation #2. It was
denied by Supervisor and Staff 1 who were in the bedroom with
Youth A, that Youth A was pushed at any time. It was denied in
interviews with all staff and not reported to have been observed by
any youth that Youth A was pushed/pulled to the floor or hit her
head on the wall. Medical documentation states there were no
significant injuries observed.
6

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, Supervisor threatened youth by expressing
that "If I didn't need this job, I would beat your ass."
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 7/24/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Staff 1 denied awareness or
hearing Supervisor or any other staff threaten Youth A or any
other youth. Staff 1 denied hearing Supervisor said if she didn’t
need this job she would beat Youth A’s ass.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
along with DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Program Manager
denied knowledge of Supervisor using threatening language with
Youth A or any other youth or saying if she did not need the job
she would beat a youth’s ass.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. As stated above Youth B did not
provide any additional information regarding this allegation.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Youth C reported staff will say
“don’t do it on my watch.” Youth C reported all the staff will say
don’t do it on my watch. Youth C was not aware of any staff or
supervisor using threatening language with Youth A or any other
youth.
7

Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Youth D reported being aware that
Youth A drank cleaner but was not on the floor when it occurred.
Youth D reported Staff 3 has said not to do it on her watch if a
youth says she will hurt herself. Youth D reported she remembers
Staff 3 saying this after Youth B and after Youth C said they was
going to kill herself. Youth D denied hearing or remembering
Supervisor or any other staff say if they did not need this job they
would beat anyone’s ass.
As noted above, Staff 3, Staff 5, Staff 7, and Staff 8 were
interviewed separately face-to-face at the facility along with DHHS
Specialist on 7/30/2025. Each of these referenced staff denied
hearing or awareness of any staff or Supervisor using threatening
language with Youth A or any other youth including threatening to
beat anyone’s ass or if they are going to harm or kill themselves
not to do it on their shift or watch.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Supervisor denied saying or
hearing anyone else tell youth if they are going to hurt or kill
themselves not to do it on their shift. Supervisor denied saying to
Youth A or to anyone else if she did not need the job she would
beat their ass.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone along with DHHS Specialist
on 8/7/2025. Staff 6 reported it was told to her by youth (she could
not recall who) stated was told by Staff 3 to go jump in the lake to
kill herself when it was expressed she wanted to kill herself. Staff
6 reported she has heard Staff 3 say for youth not to kill
themselves during her shift. Staff 6 could not recall which youth
were around or which ones this was said to. Staff 6 denied
hearing any staff or supervisor say to a youth they would beat
their ass if they did not need this job.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the hospital on
8/14/2025. Youth A reported Supervisor would also say to go jump
in the lake if you want to kill yourself. Youth A reported Supervisor
told her if she did not need this job she would beat the fuck out of
her. Youth A reported this occurred a couple days before the
incident with the bottle. Youth A could not recall what was going
on before Supervisor said this to her.
Documentation Review:
• Training Record for Supervisor documents 27.5 hours of
training including verbal de-escalation and mandatory
reporting.
8

• Training Record for Staff 3 documents 27.5 hours of
training including supportive adult training.
• Disciplinary Action for Staff 3 dated 8/22/23 regarding
leaving youth unsupervised.
• Behavior Management Polices and Practices state
Resident Behavior Management and consequences are
based on the basic understanding of your Treatment Plan
goals and objectives. While a wide variety of
consequences may be used, these are never to be
excessively punitive or self-defeating. It is clearly
understood that corporal punishment, in any form (i.e.
spanking, paddling, slapping, pinching, twisting arms,
holding or pulling hair, etc.) is not to be used by any staff
member. Likewise, verbal abuse (i.e. swearing, cursing,
profanities, obscene gestures, ridiculing, sarcasm or
unflattering nicknames, etc.) are not to be used by any staff
member.
• The Role of Staff Member states staff should never be
inappropriate with youth in any manner.
Analysis A violation is not established regarding this allegation. There is
insufficient evidence due to inconsistent interviews and lack of
documentation of Supervisor saying she would beat Youth A’s ass
or beat the fuck out of her, or of any staff or supervisor instructing
youth to jump in the lake if they want to kill themselves.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Today, the staff members at the facility did not want youth to come
to the hospital and EMS had to get police involved to convince
them to allow her to come to the hospital, even though youth
attempted suicide by drinking cleaning solution.
Investigation Interviews:
9

Complainant was contacted via telephone on 7/24/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. As noted above, Staff 1 reported
Youth A threw something at Supervisor and Supervisor instructed
Staff 8 to call the police because Youth A had assaulted her. Staff
1 reported police did come to the facility and inquired if Youth A
was going to be sent to the hospital. Staff 1 reported the police
contacted EMS to come out. Staff 1 denied there being history of
Youth A exhibiting suicidal ideations, attempts or self-harming
behaviors. Staff 1 reported it was the decision initially by Program
Manager and Supervisor not to send Youth A to the hospital.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
along with DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Program Manager
reported she was not present when the incident occurred however
came to the facility to meet with police who came to the scene.
Program Manager reported Supervisor called and notified her of
the incident advising Youth A had cleaning product in her hand
and after that she mixed nail polish and water. Program Manager
reported she was informed Supervisor was hit in the face by
something Youth A threw at her so Supervisor instructed Staff 8 to
call the police Program Manager reported their internal screening
process involves a staff doing an assessment to determine risk
and if it is necessary they are sent out for a crisis screening.
Program Manager reported police told the facility they had to send
Youth A to the hospital. Program Manager reported it was not their
intent to send Youth A to the hospital because the cleaner she
drank was plant based and she did not ingest any nail polish.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Youth B reported the staff knew
Youth A was drinking cleaning solution off the floor and reported
Supervisor stated it was okay because it is plant based. Youth B
reported the cops came later but she not sure who called them
then the cops called EMS. Youth B reported hearing Youth A say
she wanted to harm herself before. She believed Youth A said
something like she would rather kill herself than stay there. Youth
B reported she has heard Youth A say things like that more than
once and believes staff have heard her too. Youth B could not
recall what staff may have also heard Youth A express self-harm
or suicidal ideations. Youth B reported staff brush off self-harm
and suicidal comments and respond by saying things such as, “do
not do it on my shift.”
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/25/2025. Youth C reported the cops were
10

called. Youth C reported Youth A makes jokes sometimes about
killing herself and staff hear but do not pay attention to it. Youth C
reported Youth A has said things about killing herself around Staff
2, Staff 3, and Staff 4. Youth C reported staff will say “don’t do it
on my watch.” Youth C reported all the staff will say, “don’t do it on
my watch.” Youth C did not know who called the police or what
made them call the police.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Youth D reported hearing Youth A
say she was going to kill herself previously. Youth D could not
remember when Youth A said this or who was around. Youth D
reported that Youth A jokingly says she will kill herself often by
motioning like she is slitting her wrist or throat and does it around
staff. Youth D reported Staff 3 has said not to do it on her watch if
a youth says she will hurt herself. Youth D reported she
remembers Staff 3 saying this after Youth B and Youth C said
they was going to kill themselves.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 8 reported being unable to
remember Youth A ever making any specific suicidal ideations
however stated Youth A may have talked about it before. Staff 8
reported the day prior Youth A had sprayed cleaner onto her torn
up write up and put it into her mouth so she was not allowed to
use any cleaner for the time being because of that. Staff 8
reported Supervisor had instructed her to call the police and
initially she did not know why and then Supervisor said it was
because Youth A had assaulted her by throwing something which
hit her in the face.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Supervisor reported going to put
the sheet into the trash bag when something struck her in the face
from Youth A throwing it at her. Supervisor reported Staff 8
entered the doorway at which time she told Staff 8 to call the
police. Supervisor reported Youth A said she thought I wanted
that, referring to the item she threw at Supervisor. Supervisor
reported when police arrived Youth A told them she drank nail
polish and cleaner while laughing. Supervisor denied Youth A
making suicidal statements to anyone prior to this attempt.
Supervisor reported Youth A made statements of suicidal ideation
to EMS who along with police stated they needed to take her to
the hospital. Supervisor reported the day prior Youth A sprayed
cleaner onto a piece of paper and put it in her mouth. Supervisor
reported she was in her office during that incident and was told
Youth A did not swallow the paper, that she spit it out into the
garbage can. Supervisor reported if a youth makes suicidal
11

comments they report it to Staff 1 to do an internal assessment
and if it is necessary they are taken to the hospital if the staff
cannot handle the situation. Supervisor denied seeing any marks
on Youth A following the incident.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 5 denied any awareness of
Youth A having suicidal ideations. Staff 5 reported if a youth
makes suicidal statements they get screened internally and it is
determined if they can safety plan.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
DHHS Specialist on 7/30/2025. Staff 3 reported if a youth states
they are going to harm themselves they will call the crisis line or
take them to the hospital. Staff 3 denied being present on the date
of the incident.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone along with DHHS Specialist
on 8/7/2025. Staff 6 reported being aware that it was not the
intention to send Youth A to the hospital and expressed concern
as Youth A made an attempt to harm or kill herself. Staff 6
reported she heard Supervisor say the cleaner was plant based so
they did not need to send Youth A to be examined. Staff 6
reported police were not called until Youth A was belligerent, they
were not called due to concerns for Youth A’s safety.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the hospital on
8/14/2025. Youth A reported staff are supposed to have an
evaluation done on the youth if a youth says they want to kill
themselves but they usually do not do that. Youth A reported she
got on her knees and started to drink the liquid from the floor by
using her hands as cups. Youth A denied knowing what kind of
cleaner it was or what was in it. Youth A reported thinking she
would die if she drank it. Youth A reported Supervisor and Staff 1
pulled on the sheets causing her to fall off the bed onto the floor.
Youth A reported having nail polish and a cup of water that she
grabbed and dumped the nail polish into the cup. Youth A
reported sitting down in her room and starting to drink it. Youth A
denied throwing any object at Supervisor or at anyone else. Youth
A reported Supervisor told Staff 8 to call the police. Youth A
denied Supervisor was hit by anything during the incident. Youth A
reported Supervisor did not want her to go to the hospital. Youth A
did not recall what was said other than I did not need to go. Youth
A reported having suicidal ideations while at the facility prior to this
incident and reported saying things around staff such as she does
not want to be alive. Youth A could not recall which staff were
around when she has made these comments. Youth A reported
she told Staff 3 and Staff 7 she was going to drink bleach and they
12

did not do anything just told her that was not me. Youth A reported
the day before going to the hospital she sprayed cleaner onto a
crumbled up write up and put it in her mouth and that she spit it
out. Youth A reported staff were aware of this and she was told
she could not use any cleaning supplies after that.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report dated 7/23/25 authored by Supervisor as
described above.
• Incident report (IR) dated 7/22/25 authored by Staff 8 states
Youth A ripped up her LOP (disciplinary note) and put it in
her mouth then sprayed it with method plant based cleaner.
The IR goes on to state Staff 8 removed the cleaner and
Youth A removed a wad of the paper from her mouth,
appearing to swallow some small pieces while drinking
water.
• Email dated 8/18/2025 authored by Program Manager
listing the treatment team along with their credentials. It is
noted the treatment team is made up of staff with bachelors
and masters degrees. The treatment team does not have
any members with limited or full licenses of social work or
counseling.
• Suicide Precautions Policy states precautions are initiated
by the Treatment Team in person or via phone. The
Treatment Team will interview the youth and determine if
further action is needed based on risk level.
• Hospital Crisis Screening Procedure states if a resident has
attempted suicide or there is a serious suicide threat, staff
will contact 911 immediately for them to be transported to
the hospital. This does not require assessment from the
Treatment Team.
• Email dated 8/29/25 authored by Program Manager states
Youth A attempting to ingest plant-based cleaner is the first
comment or attempt made.
Video Review:
Video footage was reviewed for 7/23/25 at approximately
1:15PM. Video footage shows Staff 8 opening the cleaning
supply closet and Youth A grabbing multiple items from the
closet. At 1 minute 22 seconds, Youth A moves out of
frame and Staff 8 in a yellow shirt is visible appearing to be
talking. Upon beginning video clip #2 Youth A and Staff 8
have re-entered the frame and are seen both facing the
camera with Staff 8 reaching both arms from behind Youth
A with all four of their hands holding the bottle. At 1 minute
and 3 seconds Staff 1 enters the frame and then leaves the
frame again. Staff 1’s right arm is seen reaching for the
13

bottle from the left. At 2 minutes 22 seconds Supervisor is
seen entering the hallway, approaches and reaches for the
bottle. At the start of video clip #3, Youth A, Supervisor,
and part of Staff 8’s shirt can be seen bending and
appearing to struggle as they all hold onto the bottle which
is spilling liquid onto the floor. At 21 seconds the bottle has
fallen to the floor and Supervisor can be seen walking away
as Youth A drops to her knees, cups her hands together
and retrieves liquid from the floor, bringing it to her mouth.
Staff 8 is seen bending towards Youth A appearing to
speak at which time Youth A stops moving but remains
crouched down towards the floor. At 37 seconds Youth A
begins cupping her hands and scooping liquid off the floor
and bringing it to her mouth again while Staff 8 attempts to
block Youth A’s hands from reaching her mouth, with her
hands. Youth A then stands up, repositions and gets back
down and begins to scoop liquid again without intervention.
At 1 minute 16 seconds Youth A stands up and walks down
the hall. Staff 8 can be seen using towels to clean up the
liquid in the hallway.
Analysis A rule violation is established regarding this allegation. Per
interviews with staff, Supervisor, Program Manager and Youth A,
it was not the facility’s intention or decision to send Youth A to the
hospital for evaluation. It was at the recommendation of EMS and
the police who were at the scene due to being called for an
allegation of Youth A assaulting Supervisor. The facility’s
procedure states following an attempt of suicide, it is required
youth be sent to or taken to the hospital for crisis-screening which
was reportedly not the intention of the facility. Several interviews
stated Youth A had made previous self-harm or suicidal
comments and or/gestures in the past including the documented
incident on 7/22/25.
Technical Assistance:
The facility should revise their Suicide Precautions Policy to
include proper documentation of self-harm ideations, comments,
and follow-up.
Consultation:
It is recommended that an updated training be created for all staff
regarding self-harm and suicidal ideation and procedure. This
training should include taking any and all gestures, comments,
and attempts of self-harm or suicide seriously whether the manner
of attempt is considered dangerous or effective or not. It is
recommended that a licensed clinician make risk determinations
for self-harm and suicide. The facility’s Treatment Team does not
presently include any licensed or limited licensed clinicians.
